types.name: Timestamped
types.description:
The Timestamped interface implements two automatically managed timestamps
        'createdAt' and 'modifiedAt'.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description:
When paired with the Node interface, this is an automatically managed
          timestamp that is set when an object is first created.

fields.name: modifiedAt
fields.description:
When paired with the Node interface, this is an automatically managed
          timestamp that is set whenever an object is mutated.

types.name: Node
types.description:
The Node interface. We have added the createdAt and modifiedAt timestamps as
        a helpful extension of the normal Node interface.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID.

types.name: Role
types.description:
Roles are used to enable role based access control. Scaphold schema's enable
        both role based and relation based access control rules via permissions.

fields.name: members
fields.description: The user`s belonging to this role

fields.description: A globally unique ID.

fields.name: blobUrl

fields.name: blobMimeType

fields.name: name

types.name: Blob
types.description:
The Blob interface. We have added blobFieldName as a helpful extension of
        the normal Node interface.

fields.name: blobMimeType
fields.description: The mimeType of the blob asset.

fields.name: blobUrl
fields.description: A pre-signed url to your file.

types.name: Credential
types.description:
A user login credential. Scaphold enables multiple authentication mechanisms
      each of which will map to a single credential for the user. Your app comes
      preloaded with basic auth but you can easily add social auth via the Auth0 integration.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user associated with this credential

fields.name: type
fields.description: The authentication type. E.G. Basic, Auth0, etc.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID.

types.name: User
types.description:
The default Scaphold user model. Scaphold handles user
                    authentication for you so that you can focus on building awesome apps.

fields.name: bookRequests
fields.description:
The reverse field of 'requestedBy' in 1:M connection
            with type 'undefined'.

fields.name: booksHeld
fields.description:
The reverse field of 'currentHolder' in 1:M connection
            with type 'undefined'.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique ID.

fields.name: password
fields.description: The user's password. This is encrypted and cannot be read.

fields.name: credentials
fields.description:
A list of authentication credentials for a user. For security reasons
            the values of these tokens are kept secret but you can see the types of the credentials
            that are currently active for each user.

fields.name: modifiedAt
fields.description:
When paired with the Node interface, this is an automatically managed
          timestamp that is set whenever an object is mutated.

fields.name: username
fields.description: The user's username.

fields.name: lastLogin
fields.description: An automatically managed timestamp that is set every time a user logs in.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: A list of roles in which this user is enrolled

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description:
When paired with the Node interface, this is an automatically managed
          timestamp that is set when an object is first created.

types.name: AccessLevel
types.description: The AccessLevel describes the access levels for role based authentication.

fields.name: accessLevel
